channel.title: Comments on: The Mothers of Creation
channel.description: Stellar Short Fiction by Women-Identified Writers Since 2010

item.title: By: Weekly Wrap Up - Our First Week! - Luna Station QuarterlyLuna Station Quarterly
item.dc:creator: Weekly Wrap Up - Our First Week! - Luna Station QuarterlyLuna Station Quarterly
item.description: […] us off by talking about some of the women writers who influenced her own writing with her “The Mothers of Creation“. Katherine also donated a lovely Nancy Drew-themed bracelet as a giveway that ends on […]
item.content:encoded: […] us off by talking about some of the women writers who influenced her own writing with her “The Mothers of Creation“. Katherine also donated a lovely Nancy Drew-themed bracelet as a giveway that ends on […]

item.title: By: Cathrin
item.dc:creator: Cathrin
item.description: What a wonderful trip through the past! I loved Cleary's books, devoured nearly every Nancy Drew thanks to older cousins who sent their copies my way, but I don't remember The Poky Little Puppyâ€¦although the cover gives me goosebumps of recognition for some reason:)
item.content:encoded: What a wonderful trip through the past! I loved Cleary’s books, devoured nearly every Nancy Drew thanks to older cousins who sent their copies my way, but I don’t remember The Poky Little Puppyâ€¦although the cover gives me goosebumps of recognition for some reason:)

item.title: By: BL Draper
item.dc:creator: BL Draper
item.description: I wanted to be Nancy Drew when I was a young 'un. I also loved the Famous Five and Scooby Doo, but Nancy was my favourite. I had a crush on Ned too, before I even knew what a boy was! :)
item.content:encoded: I wanted to be Nancy Drew when I was a young ‘un. I also loved the Famous Five and Scooby Doo, but Nancy was my favourite. I had a crush on Ned too, before I even knew what a boy was! ðŸ™‚

item.title: By: Steven Doyle
item.dc:creator: Steven Doyle
item.description: I missed out on the Hardy Boys, but loved the Mad Scientists' Club.
item.content:encoded: I missed out on the Hardy Boys, but loved the Mad Scientists’ Club.

item.title: By: Christine Pope
item.dc:creator: Christine Pope
item.description: Oh, I loved the Beverly Cleary book! And Nancy Drew -- I think I must have ready all those at least two or three times. My mother read to me all the time. In fact, I don't really remember learning to read, because I just sort of picked it up from following along as my mother read to me. Thanks for the trip down Memory Lane!
item.content:encoded: Oh, I loved the Beverly Cleary book! And Nancy Drew — I think I must have ready all those at least two or three times. My mother read to me all the time. In fact, I don’t really remember learning to read, because I just sort of picked it up from following along as my mother read to me. Thanks for the trip down Memory Lane!

item.title: By: Stacy Claflin
item.dc:creator: Stacy Claflin
item.description: I used to love the Nancy Drew books when I was a kid. I started with my mom's books that she saved from when she was a kid.
item.content:encoded: I used to love the Nancy Drew books when I was a kid. I started with my mom’s books that she saved from when she was a kid.
